conversation.text: Are you ready to make caramel corn?
evidence: caramel
popcorn

conversation.text: Yes! What ingredients do I need?
You need popped popcorn, butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, salt, baking soda, and vanilla extract.
evidence: popcorn
sugar, corn syrup, and salt
baking soda
vanilla extract
butter

conversation.text: How much brown sugar do I need? I don't have a ton in my house.
You'll need 2 cups of brown sugar.
Oh, I don't have enough brown sugar. I'll make a half recipe. Can you walk me through making a half recipe?
First, preheat your oven to 200 to 250ºF. While the oven is preheating, get half a cup of butter, a cup of brown sugar, a quarter cup of corn syrup, and a half teaspoon of salt.
evidence: Preheat your oven to 200 to 250ºF
Melt the butter in a medium-sized saucepan over medium heat, then stir in the sugar, corn syrup, and salt.

conversation.text: OK, I've done that. Should I also pop the popcorn now?
Yes, pop the popcorn in a large saucepan first.
Oh, got it! I made it, and it's really good! :) I'm eating a few pieces right now. What's next?

conversation.text: I've done that. What's my next step?
Cut the butter into cubes and put the cubes into a medium saucepan.

Place a medium-sized saucepan on the stove. Cut the butter into cubes, then put it into the saucepan.

conversation.text: Does it matter how big the cubes are?
No, you're just cutting the butter into cubes so it melts better.
evidence: Cut the butter into cubes

conversation.text: Perfect. I've done that. What's next?
Put the saucepan with the butter in it on the stove over medium heat. Wait till the butter melts, then use a rubber spatula to stir in the brown sugar, corn syrup, and salt.
evidence: Cut the butter into cubes, then put it into the saucepan. Let it melt over medium heat, then stir in the sugar, corn syrup, and salt using a rubber spatula.

conversation.text: Done! How long do I let it cook?
First, you want to bring the mixture to a boil. Stir it with a spatula as it comes to a boil. Once it's boiling, set a timer for 4 minutes.
evidence: Bring the mixture to a boil, then let it cook for 4 minutes.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then let it cook for 4 minutes.

procedure.summary: Preheat your oven to 200 to 250ºF (94 to 122ºC).
procedure.description: You will be using the oven to dry the popcorn later on. While it is pre-heating, you can make the caramel sauce.

procedure.summary: Melt the butter in a medium-sized saucepan over medium heat, then stir in the sugar, corn syrup, and salt.
procedure.description: Place a medium-sized saucepan on the stove. Cut the butter into cubes, then put it into the saucepan. Let it melt over medium heat, then stir in the sugar, corn syrup, and salt using a rubber spatula.

procedure.summary: Bring the mixture to a boil, then let it cook for 4 minutes.
procedure.description: Stir the mixture as it comes to a boil. Once it starts to boil, stop, and set your rubber spatula aside. Let the mixture cook without stirring for 4 minutes. If you have a candy thermometer, use it to test the temperature. The ideal temperature should be between 250 and 300°F (122 and 149°C). If you want extra crunchy popcorn, cook the popcorn until you see wisps of smoke.

procedure.summary: Take the saucepan off the stove and stir in the baking soda and vanilla extract.
procedure.description: The caramel may start to fizz at this point, which is fine. Keep stirring until everything is evenly combined.

procedure.summary: Slowly pour the caramel sauce over the popcorn.
procedure.description: If you have not already, transfer the popcorn into a large bowl. Pour the caramel over the popcorn slowly, stirring the popcorn as you do so. The corn needs to be evenly coated.

procedure.summary: Spread the popcorn across two large, lightly-greased baking dishes.
procedure.description: Lightly grease the baking dishes first, then spread the popcorn across them as evenly as you can. If your baking dishes are small, then you may need to use a third one.

procedure.summary: Bake the popcorn for 1 hour, stirring it every 15 minutes.
procedure.description: Carefully place the baking sheets into the oven and set the timer for 1 hour. Give the popcorn a stir with a rubber spatula ever 15 minutes. This will help the popcorn bake evenly, and prevents it from getting soggy.

procedure.summary: Take the popcorn out of the oven, spread it onto a sheet of parchment paper, and let it cool.
procedure.description: The popcorn may have clumped together. You can leave it like this, or you can break it apart using a spatula.
